review.reviewBody: I have started using this almost nightly and I absolutely love the guided meditation. Keeps my mind fresh after a long day.
review.name: Mental relief to end the workday

review.reviewBody: Five stars for Core, zero for the bundle, so averages to 2.5 stars. I originally got the Core with the bundle for my son. He tried it briefly but it wasn't quite the thing for him. I contacted Hyperice support to see if I could get the bundle app switched to my phone, but they refused to do that even if it wasn't being used at all where it was. So, we love some of your products, but this one was a waste for us.
review.name: Core is great, bundle didn't work for us

review.reviewBody: The device is fine, but it’s uncomfortable holding the device after a few minutes.
review.name: The device is fine, but

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Core Meditation Trainer is a handheld meditation aid that uses vibrations to help you focus and guide your breathing as ECG sensors measure your mindfulness and its companion app tracks your progress. There's no calibration necessary with the Core; you open the app, you pick it up and you're good to go. While there is a dizzying array of meditations to choose from if you dig in, the app's algorithm selects one for you on its home screen so you can start right away. Core by Hyperice is by far the best meditation guide anyone can use. I tried them all and could never establish a daily practice, until Core came into my life. Meditation is no longer a chore, but something I actually look forward to. I’ve been meditating four months straight without any gaps. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: This device is AMAZING. I am a meditation and Yoga instructor. A friend recommended it and I was skeptical. I borrowed hers for a week and it has changed my life. I have 159 days straight. It is my go to gift for everyone. Thank you for this great product!!!!
review.name: This device is AMAZING. I

review.reviewBody: not what I thought it would be. Disappointed & a waste of money
review.name: not what I thought it

review.reviewBody:
Great product and great shipping ans customer service . 
It's an honor to shop with your company 

Thank you
review.name: Great product and great shipping

review.reviewBody: I can’t use it because I don’t have my code and I’ve emailed support as instructed twice, zero response. Pathetic and unprofessional.
review.name: I can’t use it because

review.reviewBody: This device is a game changer. While the vibrations are helping me with my breath work, the HRV feedback is where the magic is and it’s helping me change my overall health and well-being and it’s helping me be mindful of what I do or do not consume for optimal sessions and feedback. Love this device.
review.name: This device is a game

review.reviewBody: Great for meditation and relaxation and breathing techniques!
review.name: Great for meditation and relaxation

description: Buy the Nikwax Sandal Wash online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sandal Wash
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nikwax Sandal Wash online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Can this product be used to clean all models of Birkenstocks? Mainly speaking about the footbed , but also the entire Birkenstock?
review.name: Not a comment, but a question :)

review.reviewBody: I use this to wash my Bedrock sandals and it works wonders.
review.name: Great for Bedrocks

review.reviewBody: I used the Nikwax sandal wash to revive a grody pair of Keens. While the dispensing mechanism took a bit of getting used to, once I figured it out it made sense. The built-in brush was effective without being too rough on the shoe's materials, and the cleaner itself had a pleasant, but not overwhelming scent that dissipated quickly. My sandals now look great and fresh. I will definitely use it again.
review.name: Works well!

review.reviewBody: I used this to clean my Chacos instead of washing them in the washing machine and the sandals turned out looking great! One thing I love about Nikwax is that this size bottle can work for multiple pairs of shoes.
My chaco straps can get a powerful funk.  I mean leave them outside smelly.  this is easier to use than laundry detergent or fabric softener that Chaco used tells you to use
review.name: must have for Chacos!

review.reviewBody: I've used these to clean my tevas and it feels like  new sandals. Highly recommend this product to extend the use of sport sandals.
review.name: Great for scrubbing and cleaning sandals

review.reviewBody: I'm very thankful that Nikwax is back at ExpertVoice!  I've used this a lot and it is fairly easy to use.  You need to press down to get product out from the container.  It would be nice if the bottle were designed with a spout so that I can put the product on a toothbrush to get into the covered toe bed of my sandals.
review.name: Good product for sandals

name: Sandal Wash
Sandal Wash

description: Buy the Terry Bicycles Breakaway Short - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Breakaway Short - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Terry Bicycles Breakaway Short - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are my first biking shorts after years of ignoring feeling sore after the various indoor cycle classes I do. They have resolved that issue, and I like their length (not too short for someone in their 40s with an athletic build).
review.name: Glad I chose these!

review.reviewBody: Have been trying various brands, including high end names after experiencing bad chaffing on longer rides. This material is comfortable, doesn’t irritate skin and I like the wider wings on chamois because the seams on other chamois in that area seem to really irritate and rub on my skin. These shorts let my skin breathe, don’t squeeze and are generally way more comfortable than any other women’s shorts I’ve tried in long time.
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody:
Bought these as road shorts and I really like them. The material is stretchier and softer than any other short I have, and I like it a lot. I was afraid at first that the material wouldn't hold up, but so far so good. I bought a bunch of pairs and they go through the wash weekly. 

The padding is nice too, but I wouldn't say heavy or light padding -- just nice and in the middle. 

I think Terry Cycles is a women-specific brand as well, so that confirmed why these shorts were so comfy. 

Also, on the muffin-top front, they had very little affect! The stretchiness was perfect to fit nice, but prevent any awkward hip tightness. 

Because I'm just a big person compared to the average road cyclist, I went up a size than usual non-cycling pants, and they fit great.
review.name: These are so nice to wear

review.reviewBody: I use these as a Mtn. Bike liner and alone on spin bike and road cycling.  I am very particular about bike short liners.  For Years "Shebeest Breezer Shorts"  had the best liner but they quit making them 2-3 years ago. I requested they bring them back but no luck. Some of mine are 10 years old. I was on a quest for a new liner.  Patagonia's are too tight in the waist for the hips and have the diaper feel. I ride 3-7 days every week.  Mountain biking summer and fall and "Zwifting" year round.  Many liners are too short and give the pinched inner thigh. No Bueno.  Also if they are too short they won't protect you from the bike seat and will ride up.  These are perfect length.  Club shorts not my thing. I tried several Pearli and have never been able to leave the dressing room with a pair.  This short is great in the hot sweaty desert, breathes well. Incredibly comfortable even for a 5 hour day in the saddle.  Don't feel as "diaperish" as some.  I tried 1 pair medium and 1 pair large from a  physical store this summer, once I figured the size I wanted which took 3 months of trial, both sizes functioned well but I bought 5 more Large.  I liked large better then medium so they don't pinch my muffin top! ( Mine is small but it's there).  Neither rode up. No elastic gripper in the legs but they function great. My first 2 pairs are 6 months old, Survived 6 months of 1-3 times per week of wash  and "tumble dry low" which is against the directions of drip dry but how it usually works at my house.  Still fit/ look amazing.  The legs never creep up on a ride. (True of both medium and large) The large has a little longer rise so no pinching of a muffin top! I seem to be between sizes and in cycling gear I did better in large.
review.name: Best Liners!

name: Breakaway Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: Handlebars are 800mm wide and have 15mm rise with a 9 degree back sweep. So according to my calculations, the 1degree backsweep increase should compensate for the 10mm decrease in rise compared to the old bars and still maintain a sufficient attack position if needed. Makes for a cozy cockpit, competent climber and pedaller, but not so much for descending, but that’s okay, my Santa Cruz 5010 isn’t a downhill bike and I’ll save the riser bars for the downhill or enduro bikes for now.
review.name: Diety Skywire Handlebars

review.reviewBody: I have always climbed with La Sportivia and have loved them. This shoe however wears out very quickly on the toe. Just 4 months into using them and the toe is completely tore out.
review.name: Toe of shoe issues

review.reviewBody: Used for crack climbing in granite. The laces near the buttons at the fron of the toes snapped, rendering the shoe useless and requiring a replacement lace. Both bottons on both sides of the shoe bends quite quickly and becomes a pressure point in the shoe when jamming.
review.name: Laces torn after 3 use

review.reviewBody: Came here to buy a pair of Mythos, even though my wife had trouble with her eco version wearing out quickly (the laces even quicker.)  I though maybe she just got a bad pair, but the reviews indicate her problems were not unusual. Of all the bad things we do to the environment that could be easily fixed, this shoe is a weird place to try and make a difference.
review.name: Hoping the original Mythos return

review.reviewBody: I have worn mythos for over a decade, however the new eco version break down incredibly quickly. After only three months of climbing both toes had broken down. It is still the same comfortable shoe but not worth buying an eco product that lasts 1/4 the normal length of the previous version. Please bring back the old shoe!
review.name: Wore down in 1/4 time of old version

review.reviewBody:
Bought these shoes this season and after the initial break-in period they have been very comfortable and served me well for crack climbing however…. 

The sole started delaminating fairly soon after purchasing them and now, with maybe 30 or 40 pitches of use the sole is almost starting to come off! What good is a crack shoe if you can’t jam it in cracks?? Seems like they’re not very durable or they’re not using good glue or something. It’s a shame because otherwise the shoes have been nice to wear.
review.name: Great shoe w/ possible quality issues

review.reviewBody: Its really sad to see a tried and true product you have relied on go down in quality. I love this shoe and have been wearing it since I started multipitch climbing 8 years ago. I used to have this shoe +laces last multiple seasons. After 2, weekend trips to Yosemite and a 6 weeks of climbing in the gym 1-2 days a week the laces have completely ripped and the rand is wearing significantly fast. I usually expect a pairing climbing shoes to last a  bit longer then this especially when they are designed for this purpose for crack climbing!! La sportiva I love your shoes and want to use them but this makes me want to look somewhere else.  Please work on your quality and laces and I will reconsider thank you.
review.name: What happened to my favorite Trad shoe??

review.reviewBody: I have owned about seven pair of the old Mythos over ten years, and many of my friends had pairs of these as well. We all agree- this is a terrible new version that has very little in common with the previous Mythos. It feels cheap and plasticky. The rubber is not as sticky and feels thick and clunky on edging (used to be the real feature of the Mythos). The laces are cheap and lacing not fitted. The body doesn't;t mold to the foot as it used to. All in all, a different and awful imitation of what used to be an excellent shoe. Why did you do this, La Sportiva?
review.name: Horrible New Version

review.reviewBody:
My street shoe is a 43 (10) and I initially bought a size 42 (9) and they are definitely too big. My toes laid flat and barely touched the toe end of the shoe, if at all. Seriously, I would size down a minimum of 2 sizes in this shoe. With my size 42, right out of the box I could have easily worn regular socks without any issue and they still felt too big. That's how big these run. And they will stretch! I settled with a size 41 and they are perfect. When sizing shoes for a comfortable, all day fit/wear, I have never sized down this much, including other La Sportiva shoes like TC Pro (42.5) and Cobra Eco (42.5).

Great shoe for long multi-pitch and they perform better than expected. Perform awesome for smearing and cracks.
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody:
A re-edition of the famous Mythos climbing shoe, made for its 95% with eco-friendly materials to minimize the environmental
impact. It is the versatile shoe par excellence, suitable for long routes thanks to the exceptionally comfortable fit.
review.name: La Sportiva Mythos product features
comment:
Kirk:
Would you expect the La Sportiva Rep to leave LESS than a 5 star review?
Get serious...
Such a turnoff when a vendor rep leaves a 5 star review.

review.reviewBody: Awesome shoe and very comfortable! Perfect for the gym and/or climbing outside!
review.name: Super Comfortable

name: Mythos Eco Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: Great tool for an ice bucket on raft trips. Had one for a couple years before someone got a little aggressive with the ice pick. Otherwise it keeps ice for cocktails all night long. Packs easily and gets plenty of use. Great product

review.reviewBody: Awesome product. I keep one in my emergency preparedness also. It keeps things COLD or HOT for so long!!! More then 12 hours and my soup was still warm. Love it.

review.reviewBody:
I have three of the Castelli 3.0 Climbers Jerseys in size Large, the new 4.0 Climbers Jersey is much smaller in the same size Large.

As always, I size-up for Castelli, and the prior model 3.0 Climbers jersey fits perfectly, race cut, snug fit, good overall length.

The new 4.0 Climbers jersey is supposed to have the same fit, but it’s much smaller, and shorter. The fit across the torso is still acceptable, but it’s nearly 2 inches shorter than the 3.0 version. I’m not a tall guy at only 5’ 9”, and the Jersey is barely long enough, with a very high reach to the back pockets. Taller riders will have a real issue with the fit of this jersey.

I added a photo of the bottom hem, with a blue 3.0 jersey behind the white 4.0 jersey. The length difference is substantial.
review.name: Castelli Shrunk The Sizing

review.reviewBody: I’m in love with these ‘bars. All the possible contact points have been sculpted to better fit one’s hand, and the carbon construction absolutely kills vibration. Used at Unbound ‘24.
review.name: Best handlebar shape EVER.

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had these on the gravel bike for a few months now and have really enjoyed them. I haven’t fully taken advantage of the internal routing, but it is clean and easy to snag the brake lines or shift cables you send through. Right on par with other high end carbon options I’ve used from Enve, Ritchey, and Roval. The tops of the bars are arched and semi-rounded, and very comfortable to plop your hands on when you’re spinning up that steep climb with your HR through the roof. I love the little drop off at the corners of the tops where my palms rest when I’m in the hoods, and the bar blends extremely well with my Rival AXS shifters. Easy to wrap, extra space to clamp computer mounts and lights on either side of the stem. I’ve got em in the 40cm cuz I have narrowish shoulders, weak wrists, and love the aero advantage.

So far, this is my favorite flared bar I’ve ever used and they’ll be on every gravel bike of mine for the foreseeable future. 

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: Dialed Gravel Option

review.reviewBody: Replaced stock bars (specialized hover bar) as I wanted something wider.  Turns out these are far more comfortable for many reasons.  Wider stance is great as I use my gravel bike on rough terrain.  Hand numbness is gone.  Internal routing gives a super clean look.  Perfect bars.
review.name: Perfect Fit

name: K-Wing AGX Handlebar

review.reviewBody: After my first ride with these gloves, I was so disappointed. So were my hands. The placement of the padding assumes that you never use the middle of your hand to grab the handlebar. I tend to relieve my hands by changing my grip slightly from time to time. The padding is inadequate to accommodate this variation in grip. Also the stretch fabric used on the back of the glove, while comfortable, tends to shift around. I would return these, but I cut out the tag already. 🙁
review.name: Padding in the wrong place

review.reviewBody: As soon as I put these gloves on I was immediately impressed with the quality and comfort. I had been wearing PearlIzumi gloves with gel padding and the padding on these Castelli gloves provides more cushion while being lighter weight. The material on the back of the hand looks like delicate lace but feels strong and provides great ventilation. I like that these gloves appear to be specifically designed for women. I’m converted!
review.name: Padding, style, ventilation

review.reviewBody: When you say that you are sizing up, please reference your waist size and let people know if you are fit or overweight.
review.name: Gut

review.reviewBody: If you need a long sleeve jersey, look no further.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: This jersey is nice and warm on a chilly Spring morning, but once temperatures hit mid-60s it’s a bit warm. As far as rain goes: It will handle a light misting rain, but a heavy sustained rain will soak through. Some of the comments about fit left me scratching my head; I ordered a large and it fits perfect — it’s snug but not restrictive which is the way I like it. One piece of advice though, if you’re riding on wet gravel, use a fender; stains will stick around with this one. Only 4 stars because I think for $150 there should be a small zippered pocket.
review.name: Nice Spring jersey

review.reviewBody: Really stretchy so a large fits me @ 175#, 6'0" & fit.  It is snug no doubt but the stretch and tailoring work such that its quite comfy.  Agree with the other review by 'paxp'.  It has handled intermittent light rain well, not wetting out.  It does provide a bit of wind protection and has a wide temperature range if layers are added underneath.
review.name: Really nice for chilly and mildly wet

review.reviewBody: I wear xl to L in most clothes. Purchased 2X with the thought of comfort. This was still too tight and restricting plus short when on bike.
review.name: Suffocating tight

review.reviewBody:
This top is perfect. If you are unlike most of us enthusiasts here in the U.S and you actually wear road clothing how it is meant to be worn(tight with no extra loose fabric), then you will love this. It has a very high degree of stretch compared to my Perfetto tops. This high degree of stretch makes for a jersey that feels like a second skin which is exactly what you want in road clothing so it can wick sweat properly and efficiently. If road tops fit properly they SHOULD be mildly uncomfortable in the standing position but disappear on the bike. So many guys out there say "always size up one for Castelli". This is so incorrect in most instances provided you dont have a gut. Only time you would need to size up one as a rule across the board for this brand is if you have larger than normal stomach area given your height. Yes, even though many of these tops have a very nice stretchy property to them, there is still a limit to how much stretch you will get out of the waist area given the respective size. Being forced to size up due to having a gut will simply mean you are giving up ideal sizing in other areas of the garment, but you may not have a choice in order to zip at the waist. 

Either way, this is an awesome fitting piece. I love it more than even my Perfetto long sleeves as they do not have the same amount of stretch in comparison. For reference, I fluctuate given the season between 180lbs-168lbs. Its currently winter at the time of this review so I am on the upper end at 180lbs on the nose currently and I stand at 5'11''. The Large is perfect as always for me. 

Hope this helps you decide, and remember, unless you have a gut&.Do not listen to all that garbage out there that tells you to always size up one for Castelli. Its generally coming from the masses out there that either knowingly or unknowingly wear their road clothing one size too large for how the piece was designed =)  I am passionate about this common sizing misconception on this brand because it cost me a lot of wasted money at the beginning of getting into this sport 14 or so years ago because I of course listened to all the "size up one" non-sense out there because I did not know any better at the time. Once I gained knowledge and experience a few years later, I quickly realized I had a bunch of Castelli products that simply did not fit correctly and ended up having to re-buy many similar items in my correct size.
review.name: Perfect-True to size

review.reviewBody: I am a muscular on top 5?6? 170 pounds, chest size 41.  The extra large wouldnt even zip up.  The jersey appears like it would be super warm, extremely well made. Nice color schemes.  Just too small.  I own some older jerseys of this brand in large and they actually fit better than this XL
review.name: Extremely small even for European fit
comment: I?m 5?6? 150 lbs. 39-41? chest. I was going to buy Large. Based on your review I?m ordering a XL. Hope you found something that works.

name: Tutto Nano RoS Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody:
If you are a brave adventurer looking for a pair of snowshoes perfectly fit for prepacked and flat snowshoeing trails, the Atlas BC snowshoes are for you! These are also perfect for the person who caries zip ties and duck-tape in their pack, because you will probably need to modify them on your second snowshoeing day trip! Also, you will love the added feature of having your feet slowly becoming pigeon toed in the bindings as you hike.                                                                                      
           After you zip tied the rails back on, you will suddenly realize that the bindings are being cut by the metal parts of the snowshoe. Eventually the light bulb will go on, and you will realize that your buddies on SAR are pretty smart and go order some MSR evo ascents.
review.name: Perfect for

review.reviewBody: The straps are so short that they only fit a non-insulated hiking boot and I’m only a men’s size 10 shoe. They are an inch or two too short to fit around my winter footwear. I checked the specs again to make sure they weren’t a woman’s snowshoe or a youth snowshoe but they are in fact an adult unisex snowshoe. If Atlas can’t even get that right, makes me wonder what else they fail on. Lost my trust with the brand.
review.name: Straps are too short

review.reviewBody: Ive added a few zip ties to strengthen the connection points between the side rails and the plastic floor as it seems the connection point right after the heel rise is the common failure point of these snowshoes. In past two winters ive abused these a lot and theres absolutely no sign of damage or failure in them. Heel rise goes up to around 20 degrees but ive used these to go up 35 degree slops with ease. The binding system is also great, very easy to adjust and very secure and feels great over the boots. The side rails make traversing on 35 degree slops very easy and safe. Not sure if the snowshoes would have failed if i had not added the zip ties but id suggest to add them.
review.name: Great with some modifications

review.reviewBody:
When I first got the snowshoes I was very impressed the binding system is very secure once you get used to using them. No hotspots or pinching in the snow shoes are extremely light which is very  nice on longer hikes. Unfortunately on my third hike after 20 or so miles I noticed the rear of my left snowshoe was curling up like a canoe. After stopping to take a closer look I noticed the two rivets holding the back of the side traction rails to the plastic deck pulled through their plastic mounts. My wife has the same snowshoes but at the same time but the smaller version hers seem to be fine at the time but after getting home and closer examination we saw one of hers and pulled through the plastic melt at the same point. We are hoping we got a bad pair for my bad batch of plastic as these are our favorite snowshoes in very light with good traction. 
I know this is the first year with the red plastic decking and I don’t know if they get the plastic from another source we are currently starting the warranty process I will update after this is complete in if the snow shoes hold up. If the breaking in durability was a fluke these would be a five star snowshoe.
review.name: High expectations

name: Helium BC Snowshoe

review.reviewBody: Love these tights. I bought them for cool weather (fall) mountain biking but I think they will work well for winter running, nordic skiing or snowshoeing as well...as long as it's not too cold out.  I live in the mountains where we get a ton of snow and have cold winters so this will most likely be shoulder season pants for me.  The fit is slim but not tight, tight like stretchy leggings.  I ordered the size small first....I'm 5'3" and weigh 125 and am a size 6 typically....but they were a little too tight in the tummy so I sent them back and ordered a medium which fit perfect. If I didn't carry my weight in my stomach or weighed five pounds less the small would have been fine. The medium wasn't too much longer either so it still fit length wise.  I've been looking and looking for a good cold weather pant for biking and these fit the bill perfectly. I also liked the color...it's a very deep green.
review.name: Women's Deviator Legging

review.reviewBody: I haven't worn these outside yet, but they're comfortable and they seem durable. I'm 5'5, about 140lb and the medium fit well.
review.name: Comfy and seem durable

review.reviewBody: Flattering, warm, comfortable, love the zip at the ankle. Best leggings anywhere for everything!
review.name: I'm going back for another pair

review.reviewBody: Phenomenal attention to material, cut, and construction resulting in the best executed winter tight for high output activities! Bunch-free, Snag-free, and exceptional weather resistance paired with the breathability you need to keep pushing hard while staying dry and warm. Highly recommend!
review.name: Perfectly Purposeful!

review.reviewBody: Matched with same color leggings. She keeps saying that she's so warm!
review.name: Gf loves it

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to see this product because it's VERY hard to find windproof pants for women. But unfortunately I'm not sure if they will work, due to the super tight and uncomfortable waistband. For reference, I am 5'5" and 125 pounds with a ruler body type. I am usually a size small in Outdoor Research pants, but that size was just too tight in the waist. So I tried a medium, and even that one is tight! They fit perfectly everywhere else, but that darn waistband makes them incredibly uncomfortable. Maybe it would stretch out in time? But they are a little too expensive to take that risk. I'll probably return. Other than the waistband, I love everything about them. The fabric on the outside is smooth. In some areas, it feels more cottony (though it's not actually cotton) and in some areas it's more slick. The inside has a very soft brushed fleece. I don't think you would be able to easily layer a base layer underneath these, given the fleece interior. The zipper at the ankle is really handy. You could even wear them with ankles unzipped for more of a slim straight cut rather than legging. I have a 30" inseam, and the length is perfect. I really hope Outdoor Research makes more windproof pants for women, but I also hope they work on designing a more comfortable (or adjustable?) waistband.
review.name: Beware of super tight waistband

name: Deviator Wind Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Best radio I have ever used out in the mountains! Easy to use.  Weather resistant!
review.name: Awesome product

review.reviewBody: Felt as though I needed to counter some of the negativity here. I love this radio and have zero bad feedback, thus far.
review.name: Treated us well through two seasons

review.reviewBody:
I had high hopes for these radios, but a fatal design flaw in the mic connection makes these very expensive paperweights. I'll cover a few of my thoughts, pros and cons, but ultimately cannot recommend these.

Positives are: easy manipulation of the mic/speaker, even with gloves on during the winter. Main unit and battery stay inside my backpack, where they will stay warmer and protected from the elements . The separate mic/speaker unit is plenty loud, weather sealed, and has a long enough cable to easily attach to my backpack strap.

Negatives: units themselves output a maximum of up to 2 watts on some channels. This is a federal restriction, so not a knock on BCA, but be aware of their range limitations. You will likely not be able to communicate to your separated party from all areas of a resort, but they still are handy if you are in a group and trying to stay in communication without cell service. Some of the cheaper options may bypass this regulation and allow for higher power transmission.

They are still using micro-usb for charging. While many devices are still using this outdated connector, it would have been nice to see usb-c here.

The biggest negative here, which has happened on both of the units I have purchased, and ultimately renders the whole unit inoperable, is there is a small hook on the mic which attaches it to the main body of the radio. The other end of this connection is a small thumb screw, which is plenty stout. The hook on the mic connection is made out of cheap, brittle plastic, and will break. Once this piece is broken, the mic will no longer make contact with the body of the radio, and you're unable to use them. Both of my units were very lightly used, stored properly, and had this issue less than one year after purchasing them.

I've added a picture of the hook, where you can see it's has broken, but not yet completely detached from the cord.

BCA has claimed they have a redesigned attachment in the works, but I have yet to see this on any new units in stores or in person anywhere. To their credit, they have been helpful with warranty claims, but I can no longer trust these units for critical communication in the backcountry. 

It's disappointing because a pair of these retails for nearly $400. Please consider another option before dropping that kind of cash on something that will break.
review.name: Fatal design flaw renders radio useless
comment: Excellent unbiased and helpful review. Thanks for the picture, very helpful.

This same issue happened to me twice. First time I was able to get it replaced under warranty but the second unit was out of warranty when this happened. I glued it back but the mic won't work anymore. I got separated from the group last week and it was no fun for anyone

Hi Daniel!

I'm so sorry to hear about your experience with these.  It sounds like you reached out to BCA directly, but our warranty dept may also be able to help.  Please email warranty@backcountry.com with your order number they should take great care of you!

review.reviewBody: Just junk, prefer to have the option to use radio without the mic...just a problem when you need to get ahold of someone and the mic is frozen also they show up doa....a big problem.  I'm a guide in nw Colorado and communication is life and death..just a grms with a fancy cover...better to keep radio in backpack or jacket so you don't need to show off a bca mic
review.name: They are not radio experts
comment: A born worrier, I like the idea that if trapped in a treewell, or injured and immobilized, I might have a shot at communicating with my posse. As a guide you are trained not to be lazy and take shortcuts, but as civilian, I'm afraid taking off my pack might seem like too much effort to make a call to announce I'm dropping a couloir in case there is a Huckleberry below monitoring an area channel or hailing channel. Plus, the chicks dig it.

review.reviewBody: Mic dead on arrival, but didnt know until after my return window closed, all other functions work. BCA says it could take 4 weeks to process my warranty request. I think that is too long, I need my equip NOW! Not in the spring..... think BCA would recognize this... bummer.
review.name: DOA

review.reviewBody: Haven’t had the chance to use the radio too much yet but so far so good. Motorsport had the lowest price for the radio and free shipping made it a done deal!
review.name: Best price around!

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Race 29in Tire
review.reviewBody:
I admit I purchased these tires because I thought they were beautiful. Perfect sidewall color (better looking than the light or dark Maxxis tanwalls), nice graphics, Italian style (and I like Vittoria road tires). The price point was attractive as well as the low weight of these tires. As advertized, the Mezcals roll fast and are very efficient.  They are absolutely perfect for racing or seeking Strava KOMs or PRs on hardpack dirt (I've gotten several with them).  The almost solid center bead makes them incredibly efficient on pavement as well for a 2.2" mtb tire. But I have to say that unless one cares exclusively about the fine qualities mentioned above, these tires do not have great merit. Here's why: 
What surprised me most about the Mezcals is how hard they feel. The recommended lowest pressure is 29 psi. I ran them at 23 and still they were not very comfortable. I didn't dare go lower because of the worry of the lightweight/thin sidewall. Moreover, while they are efficient in perfect hardpack conditions, they are not very grippy in any other conditions. 
I've been rolling Maxxis 2.3 Ikon's on my hardtail carbon Niner Air 9 for years. They roll almost as fast as the Mezcals on pavement and hardpack but are much more comfortable and much grippier in a variety of terrains and weather conditions. I have a set of 2.0 Specialized Ground Controls on another hardtail that are more comfortable and more grippy then the Mezcals as well. My guess is that the rubber is just too hard. I got caught out in a crazy thunderstorm on the Mezcals and felt like I was wearing roller skates on an ice rink--all while my son riding Minions could stay on the trail just fine (he just might be a better rider than me too...). 
So I'll probably take these off and store them for some perfect race conditions. But I doubt I'll really ever put them back on. Time to go back to the Ikon, even if it doesn't look as cool and costs a little more.
review.name: Tire as adverstized

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Race 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: Sidewall durability issue.  Will try an inside patch job cause it's new, bummer.
review.name: Buy the regular one.

name: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Race 29in Tire

hasVariant.name: Helium Down Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Helium Down Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Helium Down Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Helium Down Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This jacket is light, but very warm. My only complaint is that it has a sheen to it. I would prefer if it wasn’t so shiny. Overall, great jacket though.

This jacket has become a staple of skiing and hiking in cold weather! Since I live in the Pacific Northwest I almost always carry it in case it gets cold. It fits nicely underneath a hard or soft shell jacket. It certainly works well and does the job and 
 I haven't had any rips or tears. I got it wet once so far and it has dried and stayed warm. The down feels soft in the puffs! I would want one with more down that's heavier if I'm going in Colder Weather but for my purposes it functions very well.  It works well as a jacket that you can wear with other layers.
review.name: Nice, Warm Jacket

review.reviewBody: I've got two other comparable down jackets from mt hardwear and REI. This is by far the worst. There is little to no down in these baffles. I've never seen an 800 fill power jacket with no loft and that's basically because they hardly use any down. Maybe that's OR's idea of responsibly sourced down, "no geese were harmed in the making of these jackets." Not to mention I immediately noticed poor stitching in spots. Also, it has an awkward baggy fit compared to my other down jackets. The most impressive thing about this jacket is that they are able to sell such a cheaply made piece of clothing at such a premium price. This is getting returned.
review.name: Major disappointment

review.reviewBody: This jacket is very warm for its size and packs down well when needed.  Lined pockets are a nice touch if you like to put your hands in them.  I'm 5'10", 165 lbs and wear a 38 suit jacket, and the Medium fits.  But it FITS, there isn't much extra room.  I tried it on over a hooded sweatshirt and it was a little tight.  If you're close to my size and like a little extra room or anticipate wearing this over a heavy sweatshirt or fleece, I'd size up.
review.name: Warm and comfortable; runs a little small

review.reviewBody: I have several down jackets. This one is far less bulky than the KUIU hunting jacket I own but much warmer. I ended up switching over to this one during my elk hunt. The blaze orange made the camp obsolete so figure the green OR couldn’t t hurt. The difference in warmth was real!
review.name: Like a baked potato

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and warm. Bright vibrant color that catches the eye. Perfect down layer for most alpine overnights or turning heads at the grocery store.
review.name: Light and bright

review.reviewBody:
Oh, brother, let me tell you, the OR Men’s Helium Down Jacket is the James Dean of the outdoors—light as a cloud, bold as thunder, and cooler than the other side of the sleeping bag. It’s the jacket you throw on when the world calls your name, when the mountains hum a whispered tune, when the road begs to be taken.

It’s a puffer built for poets and dreamers, packed with 800-fill power down that feels like wrapping yourself in a daydream. The Pertex® Quantum shell? Windproof. Water-resistant. Practically a forcefield for the wanderer’s soul. When the drizzle hits, don’t stop believing—this jacket keeps you dry like TLC told you to not go chasing waterfalls. And brother, it weighs less than a paperback Kerouac novel, folding down so small it practically vanishes like Britney Spears in the early aughts.

The Helium Down doesn’t just fit—it hugs. It’s a warm embrace on the coldest ridge, a gentle push to keep moving when the frost nips at your resolve. And with its sleek design, it’s a jacket for the trail, the town, or the edge of a canyon where you scream into the void, “Hit me, baby, one more climb!”

OR’s detailing is on point. Elastic cuffs? They keep the cold out like JT kept *NSYNC tight. Zippered pockets? They’re deep enough to store your hands, a flask, and all your Complicated Avril Lavigne feelings. And the drawcord hem? Oh, it seals the deal like Shaggy saying, “It wasn’t me.”

But here’s the kicker, man: this jacket doesn’t just warm your body—it sparks your soul. It says, “Keep moving forward. Seek the summit. Find the song.” It’s the Helium Down, and it’s light enough to float, strong enough to last, and warm enough to turn a snowstorm into your dance floor.

So take the OR Helium Down Jacket and set your spirit free. Because life’s too short to live in the gray, and this jacket? It’s the technicolor dreamcoat that’ll carry you to the top of the world and back. Don’t stop poppin’ (down), and may your adventures always be warmer than yesterday.
review.name: OR Men’s Helium Down Jacket: A Symphony of Lofty Wanderlust

review.reviewBody: It’s definitely warm and comfortable. I like the soft felt lining in the neck area. It’s a light/medium weight down jacket. I take this jacket with me to the snow and wear it in the winter mostly when it gets into the 40s and below. The fit is a little bit on the tight side. I got it in black, it’s not too shiny, has a nice matte color. It has been pretty durable so far after several months of use.
review.name: OR Helium Down Jacket

review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket to replace my Arcteryx synthetic puffy for day to day use. Within 2 weeks it's already leaking down. I really doubt this thing would last any of my camping trips.
review.name: Leaks down

review.reviewBody: Super light and warm! Held up well in windy and below freezing weather
review.name: Great jacket

name: Helium Down Jacket - Men's

review.name: Perfect as usual

review.reviewBody: Unreal, this bucket cooler holds ice better than I could have imagined. Love this and would definitely recommend to family & friends. The size and shape it fits almost anywhere and is easy to move around.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: Great tank!! Buy what you want but this is the greatest cooler for an event.
review.name: My favorite cooler!

review.reviewBody: Was pleasantly surprised how well the ice stayed without being the full lock closure. We cook camping for our breakfast beverages and ice kept for the weekend!
review.name: Love it! Bigger than expected but perfect!

review.reviewBody: In Yeti fashion, this ice bucket meets and exceeds expectations, performs well on trips, day out activities, and at home at the house.  No surprises here, it performs well in any circumstance.  The tan lid is a must as an add-on, and a clear lid would be an excellent improvement so you can see what's in the bucket at a glance.  Thanks Yeti, another outstanding piece of the action!
review.name: The Yeti 45 Ice Bucket

review.reviewBody:
Big fan, however an insulated lid is a huge miss. It is of course of great build quality and it is a fun and unique piece. I use it for soccer games and wheel it around it a cart handing out cold sports drinks and waters. 
An insulated lid would no doubt help the ice retention. I understand this is not a cooler and won’t perform as a sealed and hinged lid does. It’s great at what it does, but I can’t help in thinking that an insulated lid would make this unmatched. I even purchased the accessory lid.
review.name: Pretty awesome!

review.reviewBody: Sturdy, Aesthetically Pleasing and Effective.  I gifted this bucket to clients of mine after a recent closing.  They just so happened to have a party that weekend and got to put it to use right away.  It was a sweltering 100+ degree Houston day and the bucket (while sitting in the shade) was still in the elements.  I was super impressed- the ice - even toward the top- stayed frozen the entire party.  It held a lot of drinks and looked great.  I may just have to buy one for myself for our next party!
review.name: Sturdy, Aesthetically Pleasing and Effective

name: Tank 45 Bucket

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Mayfly OSMO Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mayfly OSMO Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Mayfly OSMO Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent five months ago and have used it almost every week since purchasing it. I work in a conservation corp for the majority of the year and spend most the month backpacking. This tent is incredibly easy to set up, put down, and is very light for a 3p. My only complaint is the rainfly. On the front and backside of the tent the rain fly curves up in the middle and doesn’t fully cover the inside mesh, especially when it is windy or storming outside. Definitely brings in a bit of a breeze. Besides that, it’s an excellent tent and has served me so well in the field.
review.name: Love love love this tent except for one feature…

review.reviewBody: Nemo calls this a three person tent, but it comfortably fits my BF, my dog and myself.  Not sure if that mystery third person sleeps in the vestibule!?!   Easy setup if you know tents.  I popped it up without instructions and then tried to figure out what a little doohickey gadget was for, but the minimal instructions were worthless.  Other than that, I like the little gear pockets and the fabric.  Great for stargazing without the rainfly in the desert.
review.name: Love this tent!

name: Mayfly OSMO Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody:
Bought this as I was traveling so SLC in winter, but I live in Hawaii and don’t have much cold weather gear. Love the neon green color. It has several details I love; thumb holes, the neck cloth to cover up the throat and mouth and then the vents on the armpits. Very useful piece. Is a little long but then I figured if you’re skiing and spending a lot of time on your backside it would keep you covered and dry? 
Definitely a good  purchase, was very warm.
review.name: Awesome piece

hasVariant.name: CycleGlide Storage
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saris CycleGlide Storage online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I sat on this purchase for a couple of years.  Finally decided to give it a try and I love it.  It's sturdy, glides well, and was easy to install.  It saves us a ton of space in our garage and is easy to get the bikes on and off.  It's a really well thought out design.  Our garage looks way better, after putting it up.  You can push the bikes together really compact and the footprint hanging from the ceiling is small.  I had to wait a couple of months go get it, once I decided to buy it, because they were out of stock, so if you're debating and just waiting, you might want to order.
review.name: Should have purchased this sooner

review.reviewBody: Cycle Glide 4 Bike Storage Solution is a great product!! A must have solution for bike organization in my garage!!
review.name: Cycle Glide 4 Bike Storage Solution a must have!!

review.reviewBody: this thing is awesome. VERY happy with my purchase
review.name: Buy it

review.reviewBody: Excellent product, easy to use. Very flexible and of robust quality
review.name: Excellent and flexible

review.reviewBody: This is a great solution for recovering garage space if you have a high ceiling.  Easy to install.  I would have given 5 stars but not a big fan of using retaining clips to hold the load.  I'm sure Saris have done the math and it's ok, but seems a bit dodgy.  Don't get me wrong, love the rack, and the solution, and have had no issues with it.
review.name: Works as advertised, easy to install

review.reviewBody:
Just installed.  Pretty straightforward and works really well.  In my case I can walk under the bikes now which frees up loads of garage storage real estate.

One issue I have is with the e-clips seem like a lightweight part for hanging bikes.  Seems to work though.
review.name: Best storage solution out there

review.reviewBody: This system is the greatest thing! Perfect for our 6 bikes and VERY easy to put bikes up and take them down, slide the tracks and get the bikes off the concrete floor and out of danger! HIGHLY recommend
review.name: Great system

review.reviewBody:
Was fairly easy to install.  Most time spent was to get primary rails squared, and to make sure secondary rails will be centered. Little thought and it is easy to install.  Ours works great.  Only improvement is to provide thicker packaging.  When we received ours I saw how rails were exposed, but no damage.
Inventory included 100%.  Thanks Saris, well thought out great product.
review.name: Seems like engineered well for reliability

review.reviewBody: Add-on kit is outstanding. The rack now holds six bikes, keeping them all both accessible and out of the way. Everything fit together properly,  worked right and was easy to add to my existing rack.  Fine product.
review.name: Great addition

review.reviewBody: I bought the my Cycle Glide in May 2021. It was ordered with an add-on kit. I added a second kit in July I have eight bikes seven road and one mountain. I read the instructions carefully, studied the locations of ceiling beams with a stud finder and the installation went seamlessly. The construction and operation of the Cycle Glide and Kits is beyond my expectation. It works flawlessly and I can't be happier.
review.name: Second add to my Cycle Glide System

name: CycleGlide Storage

review.reviewBody: NRS Hydroskin is great material that is surprisingly warm for its thickness - feels more like 1.5-2.0mm rather than 0.5mm.  I really wanted these shorts to work to replace some others that were not working as well as I would have liked.  However, even through it has a waist tie, NRS makes these with a zero-stretch thread in the waste band.  I am 5-7", 145lb with an athletic build and I had trouble getting a size large on and the thread is so small that it feels sharp on your hands when you are trying to make it work.  Once on, it was clear that a medium would be better in the water but I gave up as I doubt I would be worth the hassle of trying to get into it.  It would be great if NRS had a more elastic waist like most wetsuit shorts.
review.name: Great Material but Challenging Fit

review.reviewBody: Great fit, non slip comfortable for a long day on the hill.
review.name: These are my third pair. So good!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I recommend buying them for recreational hiking, but not for professionals because they are not that durable.
review.name: light, comfortable, flexible, good quality

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have worn Red Wing Iron Rangers for years.  Love the quality and love their history.  When I read how many military elite forces wear these I tried them.  Love the aggressive tread, love how lite they are, durable.  Now I love their quality and history.
review.name: A Leap Forward In Boots

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very disappointed with this shoe, started to get broken in less than a month of use.  Trash
review.name: Bad quality

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Salomon boots are my only choice for outdoor footwear.
Literally no break-in time. Best boots I've ever owned or worn. 
This is my second pair.
review.name: My Only Choice

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Really comfortable shoes for winter wear, and I’ve owned a couple pair. This latest pair seemed overly roomy at the toe area so I need extra thick socks. 

All in all though, I’d say they are a really comfortable shoe and I’d definitely recommend them if you want nice dry feet in winter.
review.name: Comfy Shoes.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good quality boot - used on the TMB 100 mile hike.  Excellent durability.  Not as comfortable as the Speedcross 6, which I was hoping to replicate, but still decently comfortable.
review.name: Solid Performance

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Shoe is light but uncomfortable and ugly. Forefoot is also abnormally wide. Need to bring back the Kelp/Dark Earth/Black mid shoes.
review.name: Horrible Color Schemes

review.reviewBody: Nice material, easy to wash. Keeps baby hair well protected from the elements.
review.name: Great hat for kids

review.reviewBody: Would recommend. Stays on in a variety of situations. Colors could be improved to stand up to the coolness of other brands. But function over form in this case.
review.name: Great. Get it.

review.reviewBody: Awesome hat. Fits our 5 month old perfectly. Super lightweight yet sturdy. I don’t love the under chin strap. It’s very thin and in an awkward position. Other than that I’d give five stars.
review.name: Comfortable and fits great

review.reviewBody: Love this hat. My son is soooooo cute in it, and he definitely is so happy to have the sun out of his eyes finally!
review.name: Great infant sun hat

review.reviewBody: We purchased this hat for our daughter and loved it so much! Of course when we had our son, we had to buy his own too. My almost 4 year old still wears her hats and they offer the best sun protection. They are light weight, easy to clean and stylish to boot. Plus they cover the back of the neck. We will continue to purchase until our babes won't wear anymore!
review.name: Perfect for any occasion outside!

review.reviewBody: Purchased for my 9 month old grandson. Size 6 -12 months fits well. The brim has enough substance to shield his face but is not too stiff if he falls asleep on your shoulder. Light enough that it is comfortable for him and he doesn't pull it off.
review.name: Comfortable sun protection

review.reviewBody: Crazy enough, my 10 month old actually let me put this hat on and kept it on! It's nice and light and provides great sun protection for outside and water activities.
review.name: Great kid's hat

review.reviewBody: Great for protecting baby's head - super lightweight coverage. Perfect for outdoor adventures!
review.name: Necessary purchase!

review.reviewBody: We bought this hat for our 6 month old daughter. Everything about it is awesome. It’s durable, flexible and blocks the sun from her eyes and face completely!!!
review.name: Baby kept it on her head!!!

review.reviewBody: I had saw a friend had these type of hats for her girls, i had bought one for my son a couple years ago bought one for my daughter this year and wanted to share them w another friend who just had her first children! They are a fantastic hat for any outdoor activity!
review.name: Pass it on!

review.reviewBody: When I first put this on I was blown away by how comfortable it is. But shortly after wearing it, the bra began to sag. After working out, the straps were atrociously saggy and uncomfortable. As others have noted, this bra would be *perfect* if straps were 1-2 inches shorter. As is, the size small waistband fits like a glove but the bra gives me a droopy boobs feel (and look) that is impractical and very annoying (for reference, I'm a 32D). I contacted customer support but was told that my only option is to file a warranty claim. Icebreaker, please shorten the straps on what would otherwise be a legendary bra!
review.name: Saggy boobs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The fabric is too stretchy to function as a sports top for me. Also it arrived in very pre used condition with lots of pilling. I can see why someone else returned it. Inconvenient, perhaps now that TNF bought out Icebreaker quality will go down.
review.name: Very loose weave, arrived used

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I forget I'm wearing this bra, it's so comfortable. It's supportive enough for low-impact activities. Hardly ever needs washing because it never stinks. Never too warm and never clammy. I love the fact that the band has no elastic to twist or fold or dig into skin.
review.name: perfect low-impact bra

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love the material and the Bittersweet color, so I guess that's why I tried to make this work. But after a few days of trying (walking, running, hiking) the straps are way too long and the entire bra sags down to the point where nipples are getting very close to showing (pic on model is accurate on how low it goes). The band and cups are very comfortable and a good fit, I just wish the straps were 1-2" shorter and it would be perfect. The lack of support from the straps makes this unwearable. I wish I had returned before I wore it. For reference, the previous "Women's Cool-Lite™ Merino Anatomic seamlesss sport bra" was a perfect with great supportive straps. Please bring that style back.
review.name: Straps too long, very limited support

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this as I was tired of having a damp, cold sweaty bra band. This wicks nicely, is soft, and provides support for moderate activity. I woudln't wear it running. I'm a 32 c and a small fits great.
review.name: Comfy, reasonable support

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable, washes well and excellent fit. Would highly recommend for any activity. Pricey product but it is worth it for an active lifestyle.
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: This is the best bra, period! I got it in color orange, so nice and bright, love it. The material is soft and comfortable. Seamless bra feels so good. I'm 34B & size M fits perfectly.
review.name: Seamless bra is so awesome!

review.reviewBody: These bras stretch out significantly during one wear, to the point that they sag and provide zero support. I am typically a large in Icebreaker and purchased a large in several colors. The bra fit well when I put it on, but the straps and chest started stretching and sagging within a few hours of wear. I bought several colors, and it happened with all of them. I suspect that this bra would be okay for someone with a small chest, but for anyone with a moderate or larger chest, it does not provide any support. These bras are unfortunately now just very expensive sleeping bras.
review.name: Stretches and Sags

review.reviewBody: I workout regularly (but not excessively) and I'm particular about how sports bras fit, how quickly they dry, and the style. I typically wear Lululemon and thought they were the best - until this bra! It is the best sports bra ever. It's so comfortable and flattering, there's just enough padding for shape, the thick band looks cute and keeps the bra perfectly in place across all activities. After a full day in it there aren't any friction spots, it never feels sweaty or cold, it dries quickly, and doesn't smell even after multiple wears. It's so, so good.
review.name: Best sports bra ever

review.reviewBody: I bought this top for my yoga lessons and it fits perfectly. The fabric is comfy and breathable. I would definitely recommend it.
review.name: Perfect for any occasion

name: Merino Seamless Active Bra - Women's

review.reviewBody: After one week of my son wearing it to school, the front of the shoe began to separate from the sole, and areas delaminated. We have had great luck with several other Keen kid's shoes, so this was very disappointing.

review.reviewBody: Within a few weeks the bungee shoe tie has come apart and the material appears really worn. Doesn’t hold up to normal wear.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The toe on both shoes has separated from the shoe body. Started during the second week of use. Design flaw? Cheap materials?

review.reviewBody: Comfortable shoe unfortunately the orange detailing is peeling off. For the price you pay, it is disappointing.

review.reviewBody: Just like all the other reviews in here - highly disappointed. Bought them at an REI, my son wore them for 5 days, and the shoe was already coming unglued from the sole. I returned them - will never buy this style again.

review.reviewBody: I ordered my son some keens because they are so durable and last forever. I got the Wanduro Speed Hiking Shoe and after one week the t are falling apart. I'm so upset and will be contacting Keen to see about a refund.

hasVariant.name: FSA SMR ACR Stem
hasVariant.description: Buy the FSA FSA SMR ACR Stem online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I’ve got this on my gravel bike that uses the ACR internal routing system. As far as non-proprietary internal routing systems go (you find the ACR system on several different brands of bikes), I think ACR is the most refined and easiest to work with. This is my preferred stem to use with the ACR system, because you can run the cables neatly out of the head tube and under the stem with the included adapter, or you can route them fully internally through the stem and into the bar using the appropriate adapter, which is also included. The stem comes with two 10mm and two 5mm spacers that split for easy addition/removal, and works great for gravel or road bikes with an ACR headset. 

This option is a native standard 1 1/8” steerer clamp diameter, and the non-ACR version we carry is a 1 1/4” clamp for some Canyon, Giant bikes.
review.name: Full/Semi Internal Masterclass

name: FSA SMR ACR Stem

review.reviewBody: My original valve cap broke this summer after 2 years and since I hike twice a week, a working hydration system is a must, new valve works better than the original one which as had to turn. Thanks for the speedy delivery!
review.name: Perfect replacement

review.reviewBody: Need to replace the old one and this one works as expected
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody:
Been through a few of these… they work well at first, but eventually they get stiff and hard to use. After a few uses in that state the handle breaks when trying to open or close the valve.

Anyway, today I took apart one I had that was no longer working well, and I found it was actually pretty easy to make it move smoothly again. I popped the white lever handle off of the blue body with a butter knife (easier to do in the “closed” position), gave all elements a good clean, and then pressed it all back together. Voila! It’s working well again. It may not last forever, but at least I’ll get a bit more mileage out of it.
review.name: Repair tip

review.reviewBody: Same as the old one! The one design drawback is that the plastic handle eventually cracks with use. But, the original one lasted for several years of steady use, so I can’t complain too much.
review.name: Works adequately

review.reviewBody: To be fair it happened after a full year of use, but eventually the shut off lever broke off in the middle (you have to put a lot of pressure on it to change the position). It seems to be a common issue, maybe a design change is required?
review.name: Shut off lever broke off

review.reviewBody: I'd like to like this valve, but it very quickly became too hard to shut on and off. The "extra big" knob to open/close the valve broke and can no longer be turned. The plastic used it pretty flimsy. A product like this should not break after a few months of use.
review.name: Good idea, poor execution

review.reviewBody: The original valve on the Evo was very difficult to operate, caused the lever to tear. Prior to replacing it, I read similar reviews and hesitated to order a new valve. Glad I did, new lever operates very smoothly.
review.name: Valve improvement

review.reviewBody: This is lot better than the twit bite valve I had.
review.name: This is lot better than

review.reviewBody: Great design. Nice to have water secure when a solid valve.
review.name: Easy o operate valve...

review.reviewBody: Plastic switch handle broke from regular wear in arizona - either really cheap or not meant to deal with hot hikes
review.name: Plastic switch handle broke from regular wear in arizona - either really cheap or not meant to deal with hot hikes

review.reviewBody: Gloves fit perfectly. They are quite warm and kept my hands dry as a bone. Love the design and colour, exactly as I had hoped.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: The gloves worked great and kept my hands nice and warm in our first backyard sledding outing of the season with the kids! In fact, they kept my hands so warm and dry, I had to lie to my wife and say they didn't work on the phone so she had to be the designated photographer all day. I highly recommend the gloves as these are my second set. As you can see in the picture, I am also sporting the OR jacket. Big fan...
review.name: Successful fist sledding with the kids in PA!

review.reviewBody: Outside of keeping your hands warm these gloves, have pockets on them, are durable, And have a great style to them. I would definitely buy these again.
review.name: The snowboard glove that has it all!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are great gloves so far. I have a couple pairs of XL Outdoor Research gloves, but these are quite a bit smaller than the others for some reason. The others, and OR gloves I've had in the past, have all been similar, but these are definitely smaller in every way.
review.name: Great gloves, but run small to size

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I bought these as a replacement for my burly old Southback gloves. Looks identical online. Compared to the Southback, these are made of very thin and lightweight material. The goat leather has been replaced by something plastic/foamlike and the body material is very thin. The sturdy old lanyards are now very cheap looking. I would not expect these to last very long. Sizing is also small. I will keep using my old Southbacks until something better is available.
review.name: Appear very flimsy. Southback where are you?

review.reviewBody: Have been waiting and hoping this would come out in black. Red is not my color and I am not a camo fan. Please OR, make it in black!
review.name: I would buy this if they had it in black

review.reviewBody: Great all-rounder glove. Used mainly for daily snow removal/shoveling and casual outdoor recreation. Holds up great in the frigid northern Canadian winter. Love the camo colour!
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: Just what I needed this season. They fit wonderful and I like the leashes.
review.name: Great Gloves

name: Revolution II GORE-TEX Glove

It’s the hat itself.  
Love the hat but the size error
review.name: Love the hat but siZe

review.reviewBody:
Fjällräven needs an in-between Hat Size: Medium/Large!

Remember Fjällräven is a European Scandinavian brand and their hats fit differently than American sizing. I exclusively wear size S/M Flex-fit caps/hats. This is a real nice lightweight trucker hat made out of Fjällräven‘s proprietary lightweight G-1000 material. Modern ball-cap construction with a cool retro 1960s logo. 

The problem is the Sizing! S/M (Small/Medium) fits like a typical XS/S (Extra Small/Small) hat, and is for petite size heads. The L/XL (Large/Extra Large) runs large. So if you’re in-between sizes as I am, this trucker hat will NOT fit properly even though it’s still adjustable, especially if you wear your hats backwards. This goes for ALL other Fjällräven’s caps/hats. Hopefully Fjällräven will eventually make an in-between size M/L (Medium/Large). 

I’m a hat connoisseur and I expect my hats to fit perfectly and they need be snug enough so when the wind blows it’s not going to fly off, but you don’t want it super tight because then it will give you headaches. You want it to fit like a glove, I mean hat. If Fjällräven adds a needed in-between size then their hats will fit all head sizes, and only then it will get a 5-star rating.

So if you’re a true American S/M I suggest not purchasing any of Fjällräven’s hats because you will be disappointed with the fitment and then you will be returning them.
review.name: Fjällräven needs an in-between Hat Size: Medium/Large!

name: 1960 Logo Langtradarkeps

description: Buy the Altra Paradigm 7 Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Paradigm 7 Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Paradigm 7 Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Paradigm 7 Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Paradigm 7 Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I can't say enough good things about this sneaker. After having daily pain in my feet for years, I am actually pain-free and I NEVER thought I'd be able to say that.
review.name: Worth every cent!

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to get my shoes they are comfortable but less than a month of wearing I have a hole at the toe. I'm waiting to hear back from the warranty department to see how this will be handled.
review.name: Have had less than a month and already have a hole.

review.reviewBody: I don't know what happened to Altra shoes in general, but I've now returned several different styles over the last month. I just returned the Paradigm 7 pair that was delivered today. They do not fit the same, there is no cushioning and there seems to be not enough fabric so they are tight across my toes. I used to wear Paradigm all the time, but the 7 is a whole different animal.
review.name: This is not good.

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace my 6's which I wore out. These do not fit the same. The toe box is different. I had no trouble with my toes or foot pain in the 6 version. With these, I have black toe and fore foot pain after ~10 miles. Please go back to the 6 style.
review.name: Different fit than the Paradigm 6

review.reviewBody: First, 'paradigm 7' size 9 has so much material in the toe box you can just grab it up and pinch an inch easily, whereas size 8.5 is a perfect toe box fit, but of course shorter in length than you need for a size 9 foot. I have had a size 9 pair for a year and went back to try an 8.5 and that's what I found. Sales also surprised at the difference in extra material in the toe box. So I went back and tried on my old 'paradigm 6' pair that is a size 9, and it fits like the 'paradigm 7' size 8.5 shoe...and even though it's older, it feels more comfy. Now I need a new pair of paradigms and what to do? Searching for a pair of 'paradigm 6'!. I love the wide toe box and neutral shoe, but not very happy with Altra and their product quality and consistency. Recommend if you can find a size that fits...although as others have said they need to replace the padding.
review.name: Sizing and padding totally different compared to paradigm

review.reviewBody: Love the Paradigm 6. This style does not fit correctly and the toe box is too small. Please bring back the 6 style as it was loved by many.
review.name: Want the paradigm 6 style back

review.reviewBody: I have run in Paradigms for a few years - loved the toe box room and ample but not over the top cushioning. Just got the Paradigm 7 and whoa - not the same shoe. Super hard underfoot - none of the cushioning of the prior versions. My feet were tired and sore after 3 miles. I get it that designs change but then put a big warning on it - THIS IS NOT THE SAME SHOE AS V6.
review.name: Harder than a rock - who stole the cushioning?

review.reviewBody: Good sizing (went up about .5), but ripped at the heel within a couple months. Sad that the quality has gone down hill on these.
review.name: Rips within a few months

review.reviewBody: I've purchased the Paradigm for years and have always loved the fit and feel of this style until the 7 was released. I bought a pair as soon as my local running store had them in stock, but found out within my first 5 runs in this shoe that the footbed or quality of materials had changed. While I still feet arch support, the edge of footbed insert sits under my foot instead of slightly to the side like a glove. After this realization, I would alternate between my favorite 6 and this pair of 7s hoping it was a fluke, but sadly it was not. I kept them too long to return to my local store, and I didn't keep the receipt anyway because I was sure I would love them. Oh well, fingers crossed for going back to the 5/6 style drawing board when they release the paradigm 8!
review.name: First time I've ever been disappointed with a Paradigm.

review.reviewBody: I have ordered these twice now. The first time I got the pair one was a size 9 and the other a size 8. So I sent them back and ordered again and the same thing happened :(
review.name: I would love to rate these but I can't

name: Paradigm 7 Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Love this helmet/color. Feels very light weight but supportive. Keeps your head warm but gives the options to vent if needed. Clip is easy to use. Comfortable helmet to wear overall. It will scuff easily. So if traveling with it, use the bag it came with or pack in a suitcase.
review.name: Great Helmet

review.reviewBody: Great helmet, fits really well, I can even fit a think Turtlefur hat under it for cold New England days, and the vents are easy to open for warmer days. The price was great for the high quality of this helmet! My husband and best friend have it as well, we all are very happy with the fit.
review.name: High recommend.

review.reviewBody: I love this helmet, it is very comfortable, light weight and the vents work really well.
review.name: Perfect in every way.

review.reviewBody: Love the fit, the fiddy lock, and the light in back which I keep set in blinking mode when riding. After wearing for 2 months, I couldn't be happier with this purchase.
review.name: Satisfied customer

review.reviewBody: Either the sizing or the manufacturing has changed on Smith Helmets. I have owned at least three different size Medium helmets over many years. The current Medium is too tight to even think about using. A message to customer service wasn’t even acknowledged.
review.name: Try for size first. Even if you have one that fits.

review.reviewBody: fits great, matches well with smith goggles, looks great, pretty good color selection. We trust Smith ski prodicts for our family safety and fun.
review.name: fits great, matches well with

review.reviewBody: I have been skiing many times is multiple resorts. I am an intermediate skier. I prefer the fun greens/ blues. I can ski black diamonds, but honestly I prefer the ease of skiing rather than the competitiveness. I was skiing an easy run. The run was narrower surrounded with beautiful trees and cabins. I noticed a skied off area where there was a ton of noticeable ice. I attempted to move to the right to avoid most of the icy snow. I did hit a patch, which increased my speed. It was Ll fine but right after the ice patch was a mogul, followed by another larger mogul. After having the speed from the ice hitting that first unexpected mogul sent me in a non-controlled tumble. After hitting the second mogul, I was airborne. My head broke my fall. I remember my head hitting and bouncing back. My husband was right behind me, so I loved right away. I was okay and able to ski home. I made skied away without a concussion, or even worse. I did get whiplash, but no lasting effects. I am a walking advertisement for this life saving helmet. I literally own my life to Smith ski helmets. I am BEYOND grateful for your technology, and safety features. I cannot thank you enough. If you’re reading this thinking of purchasing a helmet. Do not think twice. It may safe your life too.
review.name: Literally saved my life!

review.reviewBody: This helmet is warm but light weight and breathable. Comfortable fit for all-day riding! I'm a fan.
review.name: Fantastic all-mtn helmet

review.reviewBody:
This helmet is a great value! It does not sacrifice functionality or safety, though it doesn’t feel as luxurious upon closer inspection as more expensive Smith products. This is as expected, and Smith has done a great job with it. 

 I picked up a rose colored helmet after rocking the Smith Variance for a few years. This helmet has all the features of my last one — albeit the audio insert openings are a bit hidden in the design, but are present and fully functional (I was able to insert my Alecks once I figured out how to open up the ear pads).

Close to the top of the inner ear pads and along the inner back of the helmet there is a velcro seem that takes a bit of patience to open up the first time. Once you open it once, it’s much easier afterwards. Hope this helps someone!
review.name: Great Smith Product For the Price

review.reviewBody: I haven?t hit my head hard enough yet to review it from a safety perspective, but it?s been great so far! Warm for the cold days and vents for the warm ones. The padded chin straps make it comfy as well. Hard to tell I?m wearing anything.
review.name: Comfy!

name: Mirage Mips Helmet - Women's
