review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes on sale after wanting them for over a year, and I was not disappointed 😁 The arch support in these is spectacular!!! My feet were very comfortable all day yesterday. They were VERY squeaky when I took them out of the box, but I ran up and down my street, wearing them, and the squeakiness went away pretty fast. Other reviews said that they gave people blisters, and while i could definitely see that being a problem for some people, it was not an issue for me. These shoes are super cute and very comfortable for the whole school day.
review.name: My toes are happy

review.reviewBody: These boots are on the narrow side, but the leather is soft and flexible so even with slightly wider feet I'm comfortable in them.  The soles have very high arches focused in a small area on the foot, which feels a little unusual, but they work for my feet (I need substantial arch support).
review.name: Fields Lace Waterproof Boot

review.reviewBody: I love my new boots! They are warm and oh so comfortable. They also look great! Haven’t tested them against water yet but I have no doubt that they will hold up to the test.
review.name: Love!
comment: Style and comfort! How could you go wrong!

review.reviewBody: Love these boots. True to size. Comfortable right from the box.
review.name: Just buy them

review.reviewBody: It's a cute boot! However they are darker in person than shown in the pictures provided for the color smoke. They are also a heavier boot which is okay if that's what you are looking for, I unfortunately bought them for my elderly mom.
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Love these boots! Comfy, stylish and waterproof - exactly want I wanted!
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: While it is a gorgeous boots, it is rubbing up and down on my heels and I’m suffering from blisters.
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: After becoming a Chacos convert, when I needed to get a boot that I could wear on outings in NW Pennsylvania/Eastern NY where a day trip could include boutique shopping, hiking through bog, and then dinner on a terrace overlooking one of the Finger Lakes. Not only do these boots look good enough for that, the comfort is exceptional. I just got back from a trip where I had 12-hr travel days and many connections and steps to get from NW PA to SW CA. I can confidently tell you that these were just as solid and stylish whether shufti-ing bags from Terminal 7 to Terminal 4 when switching airlines, or hiking in the hills over the San Andreas Fault. I love you, Chaco Fields Boot. You are made for walkin'.
review.name: If only Nancy Sinatra had lived to walk in these

review.reviewBody: Cute comfortable and goes with a host of items. So far so good!
review.name: Cute!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. They are so sturdy and can tell they'll continue to look great for years to come. The arch is fairly aggressive, similar to the sandal. I've had some chaco boots in the past that I ended up switching out the footbed for something more supportive, but I do not need to do that with this pair! They are SO cute.
review.name: LOVE!

name: Fields Lace Waterproof Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Bought this on sale and was surprised by how warm it kept me!  For context, I am in NorCal, and we had several days of raining that dropped the temp to 30 Fahrenheit in Feb. It's not only cold but wet cold plus wind. Somehow this nylon jacket kept me warm (without layers, I had only one top on underneath). It did a better job some of my brand name jackets.
review.name: Pleasantly Surprised

review.reviewBody: its cute but the quality isn't there. I returned it .

review.reviewBody: Awesome fit and very comfortable! I was having difficulty walking on rocks at beach. These made it so easy.
review.name: Great Water Shoe!

review.reviewBody: From the rocky shores of Praiano Italy to the pebble beaches of Mattinata Italy these shoes are amazing!
review.name: Amazing 🐸

review.reviewBody: Excellent water shoe. My son (11) used them in Maui over rocks, reef, trail, streams, etc. He said they were invaluable in saving his feet in and out of water.
review.name: Versatile water adventure shoes

review.reviewBody: We've used these for 3 kids. I just bought a pair for my daughter. We took a trip to Florida (beaches and springs), and did some hiking in the Smokie Mountains (climbing around on rocks and wading in creeks). No blisters, they protect toes, have good traction, and do well in and out of the water.
review.name: Great sandals!

review.reviewBody: I bought three pair of kid's shoes. I've found that a women's size 6W is the same as a Big Kids 4W, although the sandals are a 3W. I am very happy with the styles, the comfort, and the WIDE sizes!
review.name: Kid's shoes fit an old lady:)

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my grandsons. They wear them everywhere.
review.name: Hydro sandals

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair.  My first pair lasted for 3 years wearing it almost everyday. I live by the coast in South Florida, so the shoes are cool and comfortable.  I wear them as a daytime shoe.  When it rains I don't have to worry about the shoe getting ruined.  It has good traction on wet days.  It dries fast.  I'm ready for action every day of the year!  I love them!
review.name: I Love it!

review.reviewBody: These are our 4 year olds favorite shoes.  She calls Rhee her running shoes.  They’re great for hikes with mud and rocks.  They’re durable and need no breaking in.
review.name: Happy

review.reviewBody: it was great shoes, sandals, my kids love it. They play in the forest area everyday and it so easy to have it on and out.
review.name: Sandals for boys

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves this style of shoe for summer.  She did get a small sore on ankle but hopefully that was a one time deal
review.name: Good shoes

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great training shoe (shooting, hiking). Fit is perfect. I did not follow the sizing instructions though. I normally wear size 8.5 (US) shoes (Nike, Danner, Merrell, adidas, etc.) and stuck with that size. Shoes fit great with medium and light cushion socks. My first pair of Salewa’s. I will definitely keep them on my shoe rotation.

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shoes! I use them in various outdoor conditions and terrain and they work great.

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable fom first wear. Use almost everyday for work, which consists of a lot of hiking ok trails and walking.
review.name: Great quality

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good shoe, excellent grip, should be rugged enough. I have an interesting shaped heel that is not compatible with the vertical shape of the heel cup.
review.name: Good shoe, Just did not fit my feet.

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Durable and comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well constructed shoe, great for day hiking on all terrain.

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fantastic shoes!!
review.name: Perfect!!

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shoe. Well worth purchasing
review.name: Very comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these a month ago and love them so far. They fit well and are comfortable although I think they are overly stiff and boot-like so far. I plan to wear them trekking in Nepal so the sturdy construction appeals to me. Also think they are great looking shoes.
review.name: Love the shoes

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great comfortable fit right out of the box and on to the trail!  Love the stability.  Sturdy and solid, especially scrambling side of hills.  Overall and excellent supportive shoe.  

The Bad:  the Goretex waterproofness is....meh!   Don't know where  it's failing but as other reviewers have noted, a walk in light rain or across a wet grassy meadow or ball field leaves the shoes wet like a sponge.  The outer material seems to absorb moisture pretty quickly and once past it, not sure just what's happening within the Gortex membrane but it's NOT waterproof, at least not after the first outing or so.  Disappointing, but then I'd probably go for the non-Gortex version after all.

Second, the outer material; it seems to love water and not very rugged, tearing and susceptible to abrasion from scree and rocks.  I'm not dragging my feet thru scree fields but surprised at how quickly the material want's to shred.  

Third, where the front portion of the toe box bends, the rubber rand along the side of the shoe has cracked and split on both of them; poor design, or poor materials; either way it shouldn't be splitting with so few miles on them.

Overall I like the shoes and would probably buy them again knowing the caveats though without the Gortex as they're a light, sturdy, well supporting shoe for backpacking and off trail routes, and they make my feet happy.  I typically wear a 10.5, which these are and they fit well, though may move up to an 11 next time to give my toes a bit more room with descents.
review.name: Great Except....

name: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Wow not only is this pack beautiful, but it was a gift and I was worried about size and using it as a multi-day pack…this pack carriers weight so well and has so many functional areas and storage pockets- can be a overnight bag, weekend warrior or backwoods 3-5 day camping pack!  Big fan!
review.name: Style, female fit, & functional

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack for my first backcountry hike, I’m typically a day hiker. It definitely is a minimalist pack and there were moments I didn’t think I’d have enough room but I did! This pack fits well and is light. 18 miles this weekend in the Great Smokey Mountains and I couldn’t be more pleased!
review.name: Simplicity done well!

review.reviewBody: Loved the color and the style--the yoke and three zipper design. Everything I wanted. Ultimately decided to return because it was too much bag. Then tried 20--too small, and landed on the 30--perfect size. Loved the arctic blue but had to trade for the paprika orange, which is like Texas Longhorn orange, not the bright orange on the website. Think this will be perfect.
review.name: Great bag but too big

review.reviewBody: Love my new pack!! Bought it for our Camino trip and super excited about using it. Beautiful blue and love all pockets. Sleeping bag pouch is sweet and zipper in front of bag will help me stay organized and see everything in my pack without emptying it.
review.name: Camino pack

review.reviewBody:
Goodness, as an extremely short woman with a 14" torso, I could not find any pack that would fit me. I tried on so many, including Ospreys, Gregory, Deuters, etc. in many different models and most of them only go down to 15" torsos and would noticeably ride far too high or feel top heavy even with load adjusters. I resigned myself to looking for kid sized packs until I found that Mystery Ranch made the coulee in Women's sizes with FAR more adjustment capabilities. This one can adjust all the way down to a 13" torso for the XS or S size! I generally don't buy backpacks without trying them on first, but this backpack was a unicorn and the specs seemingly fit all my needs, so I ordered it.

I have taken it on one backpacking trip so far and it's wonderful. It fits me exactly and is sooo comfortable. Do I wish it had a bit more back ventilation? Sure, but the fit and comfort are way more important and nothing else I tried came close. I also love the updated features on the new Coulee, namely, the lash straps at the bottom, the extra bottom access zipper, and the daisy chains. I also love the removable hip belt, which easily converts this into a day pack for my husband or makes it easier to stow for travel. I wish they kept the waterproof zipper, although the updated version does have a DWR coating. I also somewhat dislike how the side compression straps connect to the front pockets although I can see why they did that for added security. I believe previous versions of the Coulee also came with two more internal pockets for a bit more organization, which would have been nice. However, these are very minor gripes. No pack is perfect but this one very nearly IS perfect for me. As for the 40L, it works for me! My husband is the pack mule so on backpacking trips I end up only bringing my half of the sleep system, my clothes, and a few ditty bags of small things while my husband carries the big ticket items. 40L is pretty large for a day pack, but on the small end for a backpacking trip, so just make sure it works for your use case.
review.name: Truly the only pack that will fit me.

review.reviewBody: I have over 10 packs and not one fits like this one!!! The only thing that I miss on this pack: no daisy chain and no clip fit my keys.
review.name: The perfect fit pack

review.reviewBody: I have tried so many different backpacks for my climbing gear and this one fits the bill!  It has so many storage compartments, Fits my harness and gear,and is super accessible.   I hightly recommend!
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: I wanted a pack for a combination of carry on, hiking pack, and even a short 2 day backpack/fishing pack.  I have used it several times already, and it is super comfortable while holding just the right amount of gear.  I really love the front and side pockets and the top load is made even better with the option to unzip down the entire front to make finding items and loading easier.  The colors are really great too!
review.name: Perfect pack!

review.reviewBody: I have used multiple backpacks, and I find that this one balances what I want from a backpack more than any other pack I’ve tried. It’s comfortable even when full, and it’s sturdy. It also makes organization really easy through the combination of multiple large, stretchy external pockets and the excellent zipper system (I love how it opens all the way and in multiple directions/dimensions). This system is so much easier to organize than a backpack with one deep main pocket that can only be accessed from the top. It’s also tailored for women, which makes a huge difference in comfort and fit. Most bags don’t fit my small frame very well. Plus it’s so sharp-looking! The combination of black, gray, and a splash of blue make this bag really attractive. I have gotten several comments on it in the short time I’ve been using it. I really love this backpack!
review.name: Well-rounded backpack

review.reviewBody: This is the third Mystery ranch pack my family owns.  I purchased this for my wife.  My oldest daughter has a scree 32 and I have a pop up 28.  The quality remains excellent and my wife was very happy with the fit. The three zip design makes packing and finding items very easy.  The large exterior pockets are prefect for trekking poles.  I like it so much I am going to buy one for myself and save the pop up just for hunting trips!
review.name: Nailed it again

name: Coulee 40L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I adore these pants. I purchased the regular Notion pants also but the fit is way too baggy for me. The SP fits my frame very well(I’m not curvy with hips and bottom) and I now own these pants in 4 colors. It’s only been a month so I don’t know how they will hold up yet. These pants are well worth the price on sale, $30-50. I wouldn’t pay the $100 for them unless they are still in great condition after 1 or 2 years of wear. So time will tell. 

Great pants and great deal on sale here @ Backcountry
review.name: Notion SP pants

review.reviewBody: I have worn these for years and they are still in pretty good shape despite my best efforts to ruin them. The elastic is wearing well too and they probably have several more years left of good wear. You could definitely use these in just about any setting with the right fashion adjustments.
review.name: Great durable pants

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Nice weight of material and just the right amount of stretch. My favorite pants for most outdoor activities.
review.name: Everything I was looking for

review.reviewBody: I love these pants--I already have them in several colors. The "SP" version of these pants has an elastic waist band (versus drawstring waistband on the regular Notion pant) and elastic ankles as well, making them super comfy but also will stay put during outdoor activities.
review.name: Love these pants!

review.reviewBody: I bought these to wear out and about at our home which is in the mountains. I wear them a lot hiking with my dogs. They're very comfortable and fairly sturdy. Solid purchase.
review.name: Nice Pants!

review.reviewBody:
I bought these jogger-style pants mostly for work (requiring walking, lifting, flexibility). They don't hold their shape as well as a synthetic style might, but for that you get superior softness and comfort. They're also surprisingly stretchy. I often struggle to find this style pants where the cuffs don't ride way up when I sit down, but these remain just above my ankles even when squatting which is nice for coverage. 

One modification I made: I cut the drawstrings back and tied new knots at the end because they came excessively long and with metal caps at the ends that were bulking up the front of the pants and weren't comfortable when pressed across my abdomen or when the metal caps would randomly bounce across my legs.
review.name: soft and stretchy

review.reviewBody: These pants are super soft, but the fabric is sturdy and they seem really well constructed. I'm usually a small in pants, but wish I had sized down for a slightly slimmer fit (only reason for 4 stars). I would buy another pair.
review.name: Nice pants

review.reviewBody: I like these pants. I was worried they might not fit me as I have large hips, but they easily did. I can wear them on many occasions, and I love the color.
review.name: Nice versatile pants

review.reviewBody: I bought these as gift for middle age daughter. They look great on her and she is happy with them. Don't know if she has washed them yet.
review.name: Both flattering and comfy

review.reviewBody: Literally wore these for so many years until they fell apart. Happy they are still selling them so I can get two new pairs!!
review.name: I wore these pants until I couldn't anymore

name: Notion SP Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I do not own a Snow Peak but a Eureka Ignite two-burner. Eureka does not make any sort of case to fit this stove. I have been lugging it around in the cardboard box that came in. Now that the box has disintegrated I was left with the task of finding another solution. Hard cases were too big and bulky. I tried several. Finally I found this one! It is a tad big for the Eureka Ignite, but I added foam to the top and bottom for a snug fit.This case is well constructed and lightweight. Exactly what I was looking for.
review.name: Eureka!

name: Two-Burner Stove Storage Case
